pullRequest.body:
This PR introduces the canonical bilinear form for a finite root pairing, and proves some basic properties.

---

[![Open in Gitpod](https://gitpod.io/button/open-in-gitpod.svg)](https://gitpod.io/from-referrer/)

Thanks so much for this.

Looking great, just some quick comments for now. Will return tomorrow!

Thanks!

Please feel free to merge once you've dealt with the suggestions (several are just nitpicks).

bors d+

It's rare that we have to prove linearity manually in situations like this.

I've thought for some time that in `RootSystem.Defs` we should introduce:
```lean
abbrev root' (i : ι) : Dual R N := P.toPerfectPairing (P.root i)
abbrev coroot' (i : ι) : Dual R M := P.toPerfectPairing.flip (P.coroot i)
```
(they're not necessary, just convenient, especially here) and then define this as:
```suggestion
def Polarization : M →ₗ[R] N :=
  ∑ i, LinearMap.toSpanSingleton R N (P.coroot i) ∘ₗ P.coroot' i
 
 @[simp] lemma Polarization_apply (x : M) :
    P.Polarization x = ∑ i, P.toPerfectPairing x (P.coroot i) • P.coroot i := by
  simp [Polarization]
```

I shouldn't really write this comment because I haven't had time to think about it and I only have a moment before I start work.

Anyway it occurred to me this morning that in theory one could also define:
```lean
def CoPolarization : N →ₗ[R] M :=
  ∑ i, LinearMap.toSpanSingleton R M (P.root i) ∘ₗ P.root' i
```
and that presumably `Polarization` and `CoPolarization` are mutually inverse (edit: maybe up to factor of 2?) and this is equivalent to non-degeneracy of the canonical bilinear forms.

If that's right we might want to delay defining `Polarization` until after non-degeneracy has been established so that we can instead just define `Polarization` but as a `LinearEquiv` (and no `CoPolarization`).
Yes to your edit. We basically never get an equivalence when 2 is not invertible.  For sl2, \alpha is sent to 4\alpha^*.
I should mention that I only get nondegeneracy when I have `[LinearOrderedCommRing R]`.

Again, we can avoid proving linearity by hand. What do you think about this naming?
```suggestion
def RootForm : LinearMap.BilinForm R M :=
  ∑ i, (LinearMap.lsmul R R).compl₁₂ (P.coroot' i) (P.coroot' i)

/-- An invariant inner product on the coweight space. -/
def CorootForm : LinearMap.BilinForm R N :=
  ∑ i, (LinearMap.lsmul R R).compl₁₂ (P.root' i) (P.root' i)
```

I think there's a very good case for just adding:
```
import Mathlib.Algebra.BigOperators.Group.Finset
```
to `Mathlib.Algebra.Ring.SumsOfSquares` and then placing this lemma there.

I think it should be named `isSumSq_sum_mul_self`.

Optionally you could use this in a few existing expressions below.\

E.g., in the definition + API  `pairing`, and in `reflection_apply`, `coreflection_apply`, `IsCrystallographic`.

How about instead adding:
```suggestion
lemma coroot'_reflection_perm {i j : ι} :
    P.coroot' (P.reflection_perm i j) = P.coroot' j ∘ₗ P.reflection i := by
  ext y
  simp only [PerfectPairing.flip_apply_apply, coroot_reflection_perm, LinearMap.coe_comp,
    LinearEquiv.coe_coe, comp_apply, coreflection_apply_coroot, map_sub, map_smul, reflection_apply,
    smul_eq_mul, root_coroot_eq_pairing, mul_comm]
```
Note that this trivially implies your lemma as follows:
```lean
example (y : M) :
    (P.toPerfectPairing ((P.reflection i) y)) (P.coroot j) =
      P.toPerfectPairing y (P.coroot (P.reflection_perm i j)) :=
  (LinearMap.congr_fun P.coroot'_reflection_perm y).symm
```
so hopefully it will be useable in the proof where you need it (if not you could add a corollary).

```suggestion
lemma pairing_reflection_perm (i j k : ι) :
```
This might make a nice `calc` proof (though what you have is certainly fine).

I think we should call this:
```suggestion
lemma pairing_reflection_perm_self_left (i j : ι) :
```
and also add:
```lean
@[simp]
lemma pairing_reflection_perm_self_right (i j : ι) :
    P.pairing i (P.reflection_perm j j) = - P.pairing i j := by
  rw [pairing, ← reflection_perm_coroot, root_coroot_eq_pairing, pairing_same, two_smul,
    sub_add_cancel_left, ← toLin_toPerfectPairing, map_neg, toLin_toPerfectPairing,
    root_coroot_eq_pairing]
```

```suggestion
    P.Polarization x = ∑ i, P.coroot' i x • P.coroot i := by
```

```suggestion
    P.CoPolarization x = ∑ i, P.root' i x • P.root i := by
```

```suggestion
lemma CoPolarization_eq : P.CoPolarization = P.flip.Polarization := rfl
```

```suggestion
```

```suggestion
    ∑ i, P.coroot' i x * P.coroot' i y := by
```

```suggestion
lemma rootForm_isSymm : P.RootForm.IsSymm := by
  simp [LinearMap.IsSymm, mul_comm, rootForm_apply_apply]
```

```suggestion
@[simp]
lemma rootForm_reflection_reflection_apply (i : ι) (x y : M) :
```

```suggestion
    (fun j ↦ P.coroot' (P.reflection_perm i j) x * P.coroot' (P.reflection_perm i j) y)
    (fun j ↦ P.coroot' j x * P.coroot' j y) (congrFun rfl)
```

```suggestion
lemma rootForm_self_smul_coroot (i : ι) :
```

```suggestion
          (fun j ↦ P.pairing i (P.reflection_perm i j) • P.coroot (P.reflection_perm i j))
```

```suggestion
lemma corootForm_self_smul_root (i : ι) :
    (P.CorootForm (P.coroot i) (P.coroot i)) • P.root i = 2 • P.CoPolarization (P.coroot i) :=
```
